solution_line_template: If Kelly weighs {kelly_less_percent}% less than Megan, this means Kelly's weight is {percent_100} - {kelly_less_percent} = <<{percent_100}-{kelly_less_percent}={megan_percent}>>{megan_percent}% of Megan's weight.
Mike weighs {mike_more_than_megan} kilograms more than Megan, so he weighs {megan_weight} + {mike_more_than_megan} = <<{megan_weight}+{mike_more_than_megan}={mike_weight}>>{mike_weight} kilograms.
In total all three kids weigh {kelly_weight} + {megan_weight} + {mike_weight} = <<{kelly_weight}+{megan_weight}+{mike_weight}={total_weight}>>{total_weight} kilograms.
That means to cross the bridge safely, they weigh {total_weight} - {bridge_limit} = <<{total_weight}-{bridge_limit}={excess_weight}>>{excess_weight} kilograms too much.
